_header: When thou art steered to don amiss
_description: ‘Bihold þiself & þenk on þis’, an exhortation to moral living — six 8-line stanzas (abcbccbc, abcbcbcb)

PhilUPEng6.First Lines:
Whanne þou art stered to don amysbihold þisilf &
                    þenk on þis…
PhilUPEng6.Last Lines:
…But feynt frendes & fals at nedeBihold þisilf &
                    thenk on þ[is]
PhilUPEng6.Editions:
Tarvers,  Josephine Koster. 
             “A Hitherto Unnoticed Middle English Poem in University of Pennsylvania
                MS English 6.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 32 [230] (1985): 447-8: 448.
